SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client.Controller

Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.Controller.ClientController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServerClientMessageExecutor, Serializable
public class ClientController extends Object implements ServerClientMessageExecutor
The ClientController class manages client-side operations and interactions with the server.

This class implements the ServerMessageExecutor interface, allowing it to handle various server responses and updates, such as login results, lobby updates, game state changes, and more. The controller also interacts with the ClientModel to update the client state and data based on server messages and user inputs.

See Also:

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(String input)

    • connectionAck

      public void connectionAck(String serverNotification)
      Handles the acknowledgment of a successful connection to the server.

      This method sets the operation success flag to true in the client model and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      connectionAck in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      serverNotification - a message from the server acknowledging the connection

    • loginFailed

      public void loginFailed(ErrorsDictionary errorCause)
      Handles a failed login attempt.

      This method sets the operation success flag to false in the client model, displays an appropriate error message based on the cause of the failure, and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      loginFailed in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      errorCause - the reason for the login failure, represented by an ErrorsDictionary value

    • loginSuccess

      public void loginSuccess(String username)
      Handles a successful login attempt.

      This method sets the operation success flag to true in the client model, updates the client model with the username of the logged-in user, and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      loginSuccess in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the successfully logged-in user

    • signUpSuccess

      public void signUpSuccess(String username)
      Handles a successful sign-up attempt.

      This method sets the operation success flag to true in the client model, updates the client's username, and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      signUpSuccess in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the newly signed-up client

    • joinLobbySuccessful

      public void joinLobbySuccessful(LobbyRecord lobbyRecord, List<LobbyUserRecord> lobbyUsers)
      Handles a successful attempt to join a lobby.

      This method sets the operation success flag to true in the client model, updates the model with the provided lobby record and list of lobby users, and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      joinLobbySuccessful in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      lobbyRecord - the record of the lobby the client has joined
      lobbyUsers - the list of users in the lobby

      joinLobbyFailed in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor

    • startLobbySuccess

      public void startLobbySuccess(LobbyRecord lobbyRecord, List<LobbyUserRecord> lobbyUsers)
      Handles a successful attempt to start a lobby.

      This method sets the operation success flag to true in the client model, updates the lobby record and the list of lobby users in the model, and transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      startLobbySuccess in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      lobbyRecord - the record of the started lobby
      lobbyUsers - the list of users in the lobby

    • startLobbyFailed

      public void startLobbyFailed(ErrorsDictionary errorCause)
      Handles a failed attempt to start a lobby.

      This method sets the operation success flag to false in the client model, and prints an appropriate error message based on the cause of the failure. It then transitions the client to the next state.

      Specified by:
      startLobbyFailed in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      errorCause - the error cause indicating why the lobby start attempt failed

    • updateLobbyPreviews

      public void updateLobbyPreviews(List<LobbyPreviewRecord> lobbyPreviewRecords)
      Updates the lobby previews with new information received from the server.

      This method sets the lobby preview records in the client model with the provided list of lobby preview records. It then clears the command-line interface, displays the game title using the TextUI class, and prints the updated lobby information using the model's print method.

      Specified by:
      updateLobbyPreviews in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      lobbyPreviewRecords - the list of lobby preview records received from the server

    • updateLobbyUsers

      public void updateLobbyUsers(List<LobbyUserRecord> lobbyUsers)
      Updates the lobby users with new information received from the server.

      This method sets the lobby user records in the client model with the provided list of lobby user records. It then clears the command-line interface, displays the game title using the TextUI class, and prints the updated lobby information using the model's print method.

      Specified by:
      updateLobbyUsers in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      lobbyUsers - the list of lobby user records received from the server

    • gameStarted

      public void gameStarted(List<PlayerRecord> players, Map<String,CardMapRecord> cardMaps, PlayerSecretInfoRecord secret, TableRecord table, GameRecord game)
      Signals the client that the game has started and provides initial game data.

      This method updates the player card map record, player secret info record, table record, and game record in the client model with the provided data. Additionally, it sets the player's state to "WAIT" to indicate that the player is waiting for their turn.

      Specified by:
      gameStarted in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      players - the map of player records to card map records indicating each player's cards
      secret - the player secret info record containing the player's secret information
      table - the table record containing the current state of the game table
      game - the game record containing general information about the game

    • updatePlayers

      public void updatePlayers(List<PlayerRecord> players, Map<String,CardMapRecord> cardMaps)
      Updates the player card map record in the client model with the provided data.

      This method updates the mapping of player records to card map records in the client model based on the provided map of players and their corresponding card map records.

      Specified by:
      updatePlayers in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      players - a map containing player records as keys and their corresponding card map records as values

    • updateSpecificPlayer

      public void updateSpecificPlayer(PlayerRecord player)
      Updates a specific player record in the client model with the provided player record data.

      This method searches for the player record with the same username as the provided player record within the list of player records in the client model. If found, it replaces the existing player record with the provided player record data.

      Specified by:
      updateSpecificPlayer in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      player - the player record containing the updated data

    • updateCardMap

      public void updateCardMap(String ownerUsername, CardMapRecord cardMap)
      Updates the card map record associated with a specific player in the client model.

      This method retrieves the player record with the provided owner username from the list of player records in the client model. Once the player record is found, it updates the corresponding card map record with the provided card map data.

      Specified by:
      updateCardMap in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      ownerUsername - the username of the player whose card map record is to be updated
      cardMap - the card map record containing the updated data

      This method updates the secret information record of the player in the client model with the provided data.

      Specified by:
      updateSecret in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      secret - the player's secret information record to be updated

    • updateClientGameState

      public void updateClientGameState(PlayerStates newState)
      Updates the client game state in the client model.

      This method updates the client game state in the client model with the provided new state. Additionally, it sets the operation successful flag to true and proceeds to the next state.

      Specified by:
      updateClientGameState in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      newState - the new game state to be updated

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver(List<PlayerRecord> players)
      Notifies the client that the game is over.

      This method updates the client model to mark the operation as successful, sets the winners of the game, and proceeds to the next state.

      Specified by:
      gameOver in interface ServerClientMessageExecutor
      Parameters:
      players - the list of players who won the game
